Source.Name: libpng
Source.Description: The Portable Network Graphics (PNG) format was designed to replace the older and simpler GIF format and, to some extent, the much more complex TIFF format. Project's main aim is to concentrate on two major uses: the World Wide Web (WWW) and image-editing.

Source.Name: lvm2
Source.Description: LVM2 includes all of the support for handling read/write operations physical and logical volumes.

Package.Name: device-mapper
Package.Summary: Light-weight kernel component can support user-space tools for logical volume management
Package.Description: Device-mapper includes the driver enables the definition of new block devices composed of ranges of sectors of existing devices to define disk partitions or logical volumes.

Package.Name: device-mapper-devel
Package.Summary: Development libraries and headers for device-mapper
Package.Description: Device-mapper-devel contains files needed to develop applications that use the device-mapper libraries.

Package.Name: device-mapper-event
Package.Description: This package contains the dmeventd daemon for monitoring the state of device-mapper devices.

Package.Name: device-mapper-event-devel
Package.Summary: Development libraries and headers for the device-mapper event daemon
Package.Description: This contains contains files needed to develop applications that use the device-mapper event library.

Package.Name: lvm2
Package.Description: LVM2 includes all of the support for handling read/write operations on physical volumes,creating volume groups from one or more physical volumes and creating one or more logical volumes in volume groups.

Package.Name: lvm2-devel
Package.Description: This package contains files needed to develop applications that use the lvm2 libraries.

Package.Name: dietlibc-libdevmapper
Package.Summary: Static devmapper library built with dietlibc
Package.Description: device mapper contains ioctl library and utilities for use with logical volume management (LVM2) built with dietlibc

Package.Name: device-mapper-static
Package.Summary: Staticaly linked Device-mapper library and utility
Package.Description: device mapper contains statically linked libraries and utility for initramfs.

Package.Name: lvm2-static
Package.Summary: Staticaly linked Logical Volume Management utilities
Package.Description: Number of utilities for creating, checking, and repairing logical volumes - statically linked for initramfs.

Source.Name: docbook-xsl
Source.Summary: Norman Walsh's XSL stylesheets for DocBook XML
Source.Description: These XSL stylesheets allow you to transform any DocBook XML document to other formats such as HTML, FO and XHTML.

Source.Name: asciidoc
Source.Summary: Text document format for writing documents
Source.Description: AsciiDoc is a text document format for writing short documents, articles, books and UNIX man pages. AsciiDoc files can be translated to HTML and DocBook markups using the asciidoc command.

Source.Name: xmlto
Source.Summary: A frontend to an XSL toolchain
Source.Description: The purpose of xmlto is to convert an XML file to the desired format using whatever means necessary.

Source.Name: sgml-common
Source.Summary: Base ISO character entities and utilities for SGML
Source.Description: Sgml-common is a collection of entities and document type definitions (DTDs) useful for SGML processing.

Source.Name: docbook-xml
Source.Description: Contains Docbook DTD for XML. A widely used XML scheme for writing documentation and help

Source.Name: autoconf213
Source.Summary: Used to create autoconfiguration files version 2.13
Source.Description: Used to create autoconfiguration files, Autoconf is an extensible package of m4 macros that produce shell scripts to automatically configure software source code packages.

Source.Name: re2c
Source.Summary: A tool for generating C-based recognizers from regular expressions
Source.Description: ACM Letters on Programming Languages and Systems (LOPLAS)

Source.Name: ninja
Source.Summary: Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed.
Source.Description: Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed.

Source.Name: tcl
Source.Description: Tcl provides a powerful platform for creating integration applications that tie together diverse applications, protocols, devices, and frameworks.

Source.Name: tcltk
Source.Summary: An X11 toolkit implemented with the Tcl scripting language
Source.Description: Tk is an X Windows widget set designed to work closely with the tcl scripting language. It allows you to write simple programs with full featured GUIs in only a little more time then it takes to write a text based interface.

Source.Name: setuptools
Source.Description: python-setuptools is a collection of enhancements to the Python distutils that allow you to more easily build and distribute Python packages, especially ones that have dependencies on other packages.

Source.Name: python
Source.Summary: An interpreted, interactive, object-orientated programming language
Source.Description: Python is a dynamic object-oriented programming language that can be used for many kinds of software development. It offers strong support for integration with other languages and tools, comes with extensive standard libraries, and can be learned in a few days.

Package.Name: idle
Package.Summary: An Integrated Development Environment for Python

Source.Name: dbus-python
Source.Description: dbus-python provides a Python module which wraps the D-Bus programming API.

Package.Name: dbus-python-common
Package.Summary: Common dbus-python files shared between dbus-python and dbus-python3

Source.Name: python-pycurl
Source.Description: PycURL is a Python interface to libcurl. PycURL can be used to fetch objects identified by a URL from a Python program.

Source.Name: psutil
Source.Summary: A cross-platform process utilities module for Python
Source.Description: psutil is a module providing an interface for retrieving information on all running processes and system utilization (CPU, memory) in a portable way by using Python, implementing many functionalities offered by command line tools like ps, top, kill, lsof and netstat.

Source.Name: gobject-introspection
Source.Description: gobject-introspection can scan C header and source files in order to generate introspection typelib files. It also provides an API to examine typelib files, useful for creating language bindings among other things.

Source.Name: spidermonkey
Source.Description: Spidermonkey is Mozilla's C implementation of JavaScript.

Source.Name: openrc
Source.Summary: Dependency based init system that works with sysvinit.
Source.Description: Dependency based init system that works with sysvinit.

Source.Name: sysvinit
Source.Summary: Programs which control basic system processes
Source.Description: sysvinit package contains a group of utilities that control the very basic functions of your system. sysvinit contains the init program, the first program started by the Linux kernel when the system boots.

Package.Name: sysvinit-tools
Package.Summary: Tools used for process and utmp management

Source.Name: openrc-tmpfiles
Source.Summary: Lime GNU/ Linux service scripts for openrc
Source.Description: Lime GNU/ Linux service scripts for openrc

Source.Name: curl
Source.Summary: A ut ility for getting files from remote servers
Source.Description: curl is a command line tool for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting various protocols.

Source.Name: rsyslog
Source.Summary: Enhanced system logging and kernel message trapping daemons
Source.Description: rsyslog is an enhanced multi-threaded syslogd supporting, among others, MySQL, syslog/tcp, RFC 3195, permitted sender lists, filtering on any message part, and fine grain output format control. It is quite compatible with stock sysklogd and can be used as a drop-in replacement.

Source.Name: libfastjson
Source.Summary: A performance-focused json library for C
Source.Description: A performance-focused json library for C

Source.Name: v86d
Source.Description: v86d is a userspace helper that runs x86 code in an emulated environment. It is used by the kernel framebuffer driver uvesafb.

Source.Name: cracklib
Source.Description: CrackLib tests passwords to determine whether they match certain security-oriented characteristics, with the purpose of stopping users from choosing passwords that are easy to guess.

Source.Name: libuser
Source.Summary: A user and group account administration library
Source.Description: libuser implements a standardized interface for manipulating and administering user and group accounts. The library uses pluggable back-ends to interface to its data sources.

Source.Name: bash
Source.Description: A widely-used command interpreter; it performs many types of expansions and substitutions on a givecommand line before executing it, thus making this interpreter a powerful tool.

Source.Name: perl-Locale-gettext
Source.Summary: A Perl module for accessing the GNU locale utilities
Source.Description: The gettext module permits access from Perl to the gettext() family of functions for retrieving message strings from databases constructed to internationalize software.

Source.Name: timezone
Source.Description: timezone includes timezone data files and tools to use them. Package contents are synchronized with glibc tree.

Source.Name: dhcpcd
Source.Description: An RFC2131 and RFC1541 compliant DHCP client daemon. dhcpcd gets an IP address and other information from a corresponding DHCP server, configures the network interface automatically, and tries to renew the lease time according to RFC2131 or RFC1541 depending on the command line option.

Source.Name: libcap
Source.Description: libcap is a library for getting and setting POSIX.1e (formerly POSIX 6) draft 15 capabilities.

Source.Name: nspr
Source.Description: Netscape Portable Runtime (NSPR) provides a platform-neutral API for system level and libc like functions. The API is used in the Mozilla client, many of Netscape/AOL/iPlanet's and other software offerings.

Source.Name: attr
Source.Summary: A set of tools for manipulatig extended attributes on filesystem objects.
Source.Description: The attr package contains utilities to administer the extended attributes on filesystem objects.

Source.Name: busybox
Source.Summary: Statically linked binary providing simplified versions of system commands
Source.Description: busybox is a single binary which includes versions of a large number of system commands, including a shell.

Source.Name: help2man
Source.Summary: GNU utility to convert program --help output to a man page
Source.Description: Help2man is a tool which generate man page from help text of programs.

Source.Name: libusb
Source.Description: Project's main aim is to create a library for use by user level applications to access USB devices regardless of OS.

Source.Name: gperftools
Source.Description: Perf Tools is a collection of a high-performance multi-threaded malloc() implementation, plus some pretty nifty performance analysis tools.

Package.Name: gperftools-devel
Package.Description: gperftools-devel provides development headers for gperftools.

Package.Name: gperftools-docs
Package.Description: gperftools-docs provides documentation files for gperftools.

Source.Name: zip
Source.Description: Zip is a compression and file packaging/archive utility. Zip is useful for packaging a set of files for distribution, for archiving files, and for saving disk space by temporarily compressing unused files or directories.

Source.Name: miscfiles
Source.Description: miscfiles is a collection of data files for freely available information, like airport, country, currencies, city information, and codes. It also includes the Unicode character database.

Source.Name: bzip2
Source.Description: bzip2 is high-quality data compressor. It typically compresses files to within 10% to 15% of the best available techniques (the PPM family of statistical compressors), whilst being around twice as fast at compression and six times faster at decompression.

Source.Name: gdbm
Source.Summary: Standard GNU database libraries included for compatibility with Perl
Source.Description: GNU dbm is a set of database routines that use extensible hashing. It works similar to the standard UNIX dbm routines.

Source.Name: libpcre
Source.Description: The PCRE (Perl Compatible Regular Expressions) library is a set of functions that implement regular expression pattern matching using the same syntax and semantics as Perl 5.

Source.Name: libpipeline
Source.Description: libpipeline is a C library for manipulating pipelines of subprocesses in a flexible and convenient way.

Source.Name: tar
Source.Description: The GNU tar program saves many files together in one archive and can restore individual files (or all of the files) from that archive.

Source.Name: pcmciautils
Source.Summary: Various utilities dealing with the PCMCIA bus
Source.Description: pcmciautils contains the initialization tools necessary to allow the PCMCIA subsystem to behave as every other hotpluggable bus system.

Source.Name: xz
Source.Description: XZ Utils provide a general purpose data compression library and command line tools. The .xz format supports multiple compression algorithms, which are called "filters" in context of XZ Utils. The primary filter is currently LZMA2.

Source.Name: vixie-cron
Source.Summary: Paul Vixie's cron daemon, a fully featured crond implementation
Source.Description: Vixie cron (Cron is a daemon that runs scheduled tasks.) is a full featured cron implementation based on SysV cron. Each user has his own crontab ( Crontab (CRON TABle) is a file which contains the schedule of cron) and is allowed to specify environment variables within that crontab.

Source.Name: dbus-glib
Source.Description: dbus-glib is an add-on library to integrate the standard D-Bus library with the GLib thread abstraction and main loop.

Source.Name: unzip
Source.Description: UnZip enables us to extract archives compressed in .zip format (also called "zipfiles").

Source.Name: pciutils
Source.Summary: Various utilities dealing with the PCI bus
Source.Description: The PCI Utilities are a collection of programs for inspecting and manipulating configuration of PCI devices.

Source.Name: sysfsutils
Source.Description: These are a set of utilites built upon sysfs, a new virtual filesystem in Linux kernel versions 2.5+ that exposes a system's device tree.

Source.Name: texinfo
Source.Summary: The GNU info program and utilities
Source.Description: Texinfo is a documentation system that can produce both online information and printed output from a single source file. The GNU Project uses the Texinfo file format for most of its documentation.

Source.Name: e2fsprogs
Source.Description: e2fsprogs provides the filesystem utilities for use with the ext2 filesystem. It also supports the ext3/4 filesystem with journaling support.

Source.Name: biosdevname
Source.Description: Biosdevname is a udev helper utility developed by Dell and released under the GNU General Public License (GPL). It provides a consistent naming mechanism for network devices based on their physical location as suggested by the system BIOS.

Source.Name: ncurses
Source.Description: The NCurses is a library of functions that manage an application's display on character-cell terminals. The NCurses library defines many functions such as moving mouse and cursor, keyboard mapping and dispaying in color.

Source.Name: gzip
Source.Description: gzip (GNU zip) is a popular data compression program written for the GNU project.

Source.Name: libcap-ng
Source.Description: libcap-ng is a library that makes using POSIX capabilities easier.

Package.Name: libcap-ng-utils
Package.Summary: Utilities to analyse the POSIX capabilities on running processes

Source.Name: cpio
Source.Summary: A file archival tool which can also read and write tar files
Source.Description: GNU cpio copies files into or out of a cpio or tar archive. The archive can be another file on the disk, a magnetic tape, or a pipe. GNU cpio supports the following archive formats: binary, old ASCII, new ASCII, crc, HPUX binary, HPUX old ASCII, old tar, and POSIX.1 tar.

Source.Name: liblogging
Source.Summary: Easy to use, portable, open source library for system logging
Source.Description: Liblogging offers an enhanced replacement for the syslog() call, but retains its ease of use.

Source.Name: libidn2
Source.Description: GNU Libidn is an implementation of the Stringprep, Punycode and IDNA specifications defined by the IETF Internationalized Domain Names (IDN) working group, used for internationalized domain names. The C library is available under the GNU Lesser General Public License.

Source.Name: libffi
Source.Summary: A portable foreign function interface library
Source.Description: The libffi library provides a portable, high level programming interface to various calling conventions.

Source.Name: gperf
Source.Description: gperf is a perfect hash function generator. For a given list of strings, it produces a hash function and hash table, in form of C or C++ code, for looking up a value depending on the input string. The hash function is perfect, which means that the hash table has no collisions, and the hash table lookup needs a single string comparison only.

Source.Name: glib2
Source.Summary: A library of handy utility functions
C programlama dili için glib kütüphanesi
La librairie GLib2 de routines C.
Source.Description: glib2 is the low-level core library that forms the basis for projects such as GTK+ and GNOME. It provides data structure handling for C, portability wrappers, and interfaces for such runtime functionality as an event loop, threads, dynamic loading, and an object system.

glib2, GTK+ ve GNOME gibi projelerin temelini oluşturan düşük seviyeli çekirdek kütüphanedir. C için veri yapıları, taşınabilirlik katmanları ve çeşitli çalışma zamanı işlevleri için arabirimler sunar.

Package.Name: glib2-docs
Package.Description: Extensive documentation for developers wanting to use the GLib Library

Source.Name: sed
Source.Description: Sed is a stream editor. A stream editor is used to perform basic text transformations on an input stream (a file or input from a pipeline).

Source.Name: libidn
Source.Description: GNU Libidn is an implementation of the Stringprep, Punycode and IDNA specifications defined by the IETF Internationalized Domain Names (IDN) working group, used for internationalized domain names. The C library is available under the GNU Lesser General Public License.

Source.Name: libxml2
Source.Summary: Version 2 of the library to manipulate XML files
Source.Description: Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project (but usable outside of the Gnome platform).

Source.Name: db
Source.Description: The Berkeley Database (Berkeley DB) is a programmatic toolkit that provides embedded database support for both traditional and client/server applications. The Berkeley DB includes B+tree, Extended Linear Hashing, Fixed and Variable-length record access methods, transactions, locking, logging, shared memory caching, and database recovery. The Berkeley DB supports C, C++, Java, and Perl APIs. It is used by many applications, including Python and Perl, so this should be installed on all systems.

Source.Name: expat
Source.Description: This is expat, the C library for parsing XML, written by James Clark. Expat is a stream oriented XML parser. This means that you register handlers with the parser prior to starting the parse. These handlers are called when the parser discovers the associated structures in the document being parsed. A start tag is an example of the kind of structures for which you may register handlers.

Source.Name: openssl
Source.Summary: Toolkit for SSL v2/v3 and TLS v1
Source.Description: OpenSSL is a cryptography toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) network protocols and related cryptography standards required by them.

Source.Name: net-tools
Source.Description: net-tools is a collection of programs that form the base set of the networking tools for the Linux operating system. It includes arp, hostname, ifconfig, ipmaddr, iptunnel, mii-tool, nameif, netstat, plipconfig, rarp, route and slattach.

Source.Name: fuse
Source.Summary: An interface for filesystems implemented in userspace
Source.Description: fuse is a backend allowing regular users to (un)mount filesystems for their own use.

Source.Name: man-db
Source.Summary: Application to read Linux man pages
Source.Description: Man package consists of programs which is used to read most of the documentation available in linux system. For example, you can write "man nameoftheprogram" into the konsole or "man:nameoftheprogram" into the konqueror to get a detailed usage information for many programs.

Source.Name: diffutils
Source.Summary: Tools to make diffs and compare files
Source.Description: You can use the diff command to show differences between two files, or each corresponding file in two directories. diff outputs differences between files line by line in any of several formats, selectable by command line options.

Source.Name: libunistring
Source.Description: This library provides functions for manipulating Unicode strings and for manipulating C strings according to the Unicode standard.

Source.Name: libestr
Source.Description: libestr - some essentials for string handling (and a bit more)

Source.Name: kbd
Source.Description: The kbd package contains keytable files and keyboard utilities compatible with kernel version 1.1.54 and later.

Source.Name: lsb-release
Source.Description: lsb-release prints certain LSB (Linux Standard Base) and distribution information.

Source.Name: eudev
Source.Summary: eudev is a fork of system-udev
Source.Description: eudev is a fork of system-udev with the goal of obtaining better compatibility with existing software such as OpenRC and Upstart, older kernels, various toolchains and anything else required by users and various distributions.

Source.Name: procps
Source.Summary: Standard informational utilities and process-handling tools
Source.Description: procps is the package that has a bunch of small useful utilities that give information about processes using the /proc filesystem. The package includes the programs ps, top, vmstat, w, kill, free, slabtop, and skill.

Source.Name: shadow
Source.Summary: Utilities to deal with user accounts
Source.Description: The Shadow password file utilities package includes programs necessary to convert traditional V7 *NIX password files to the SVR4 shadow password format, and additional tools to maintain password and group files (that work with both shadow and non-shadow passwords).

Source.Name: util-linux
Source.Description: The util-linux package contains a large variety of low-level system utilities that are necessary for a Linux system to function.

Package.Name: uuidd
Package.Summary: Helper daemon to guarantee uniqueness of time-based UUIDs

Source.Name: gawk
Source.Description: The awk utility interprets a special-purpose programming language that makes it possible to handle simple data-reformatting jobs with just a few lines of code. It helps you to make changes in various text files wherever certain patterns appear, or extract data from parts of certain lines while discarding the rest. Gawk is the GNU implementation of awk.

Source.Name: kmod
Source.Description: Linux kernel module management utilities

Source.Name: perl
Source.Summary: Larry Wall's Practical Extraction and Reporting Language
Source.Description: Perl is a high-level programming language with roots in C, sed, awk and shell scripting. Perl is good at handling processes and files, and is especially good at handling text. Perl's hallmarks are practicality and efficiency. While it is used to do a lot of different things, Perl's most common applications are system administration utilities and web programming. A large proportion of the CGI scripts on the web are written in Perl. You need the perl package installed on your system so that your system can handle Perl scripts.

Source.Name: libunwind
Source.Summary: Call chain tracer of a program
Source.Description: libunwind is a portable and efficient C programming interface (API) to determine the call chain of a program.

Source.Name: libgcrypt
Source.Description: Libgcrypt is a general purpose crypto library based on the code used in GNU Privacy Guard.

Source.Name: python3
Source.Summary: Next generation of the python high-level scripting language
Source.Description: Next generation of the python high-level scripting language

Package.Name: idle3
Package.Summary: An Integrated Development Environment for Python

Source.Name: coreutils
Source.Summary: A set of basic GNU tools commonly used in shell scripts
Source.Description: Standard GNU file utilities (chmod, cp, dd, dir, ls...), text utilities (sort, tr, head, wc..), and shell utilities (whoami, who,...)

Source.Name: zlib
Source.Description: Zlib is a general-purpose, patent-free, lossless data compression library which is used by many different programs.

Package.Name: minizip
Package.Summary: Library for manipulating files from a zip archive

Source.Name: time
Source.Summary: A GNU utility for monitoring a program's use of system resources
Source.Description: time utility runs another program, collects information about the resources used by that program while it is running, and displays the results.

Source.Name: tcp-wrappers
Source.Description: With this package you can monitor and filter incoming requests for the SYSTAT, FINGER, FTP, TELNET, RLOGIN, RSH, EXEC, TFTP, TALK, and other network services. It supports both 4.3BSD-style sockets and System V.4-style TLI.

Source.Name: libgpg-error
Source.Summary: Library for error values used by GnuPG components
Source.Description: libgpg-error is a library that defines common error values for all GnuPG components.

Source.Name: less
Source.Description: The less utility is a text file browser that resembles more, but has more capabilities. Less allows you to move backwards in the file as well as forwards. Since less doesn't have to read the entire input file before it starts, less starts up more quickly than text editors (for example, vi).

Source.Name: readline
Source.Description: The GNU Readline library provides a set of functions for use by applications that allow users to edit command lines as they are typed in. Both Emacs and vi editing modes are available. The Readline library includes additional functions to maintain a list of previously-entered command lines, to recall and perhaps reedit those lines, and perform csh-like history expansion on previous commands.

Source.Name: groff
Source.Description: groff is a document formatting system. Groff takes standard text and formatting commands as input and produces formatted output.

Source.Name: dbus
Source.Summary: A message bus system, a simple way for applications to talk to each other
Source.Description: D-Bus supplies both a system daemon (for events such as "new hardware device added" or "printer queue changed") and a per-user-login-session daemon (for general IPC needs among user applications). Also, the message bus is built on top of a general one-to-one message passing framework, which can be used by any two apps to communicate directly (without going through the message bus daemon). Currently the communicating applications are on one computer, but TCP/IP option is available and remote support planned.

Source.Name: man-pages
Source.Summary: The Man-pages package contains over 2200 man pages.
Source.Description: Describe C programming language functions important device files and significant configuration files.

Source.Name: sqlite
Source.Summary: An SQL Database Engine in a C Library
Source.Description: SQLite is a small C library that implements a self-contained, embeddable, zero-configuration SQL database engine. Supports databases up to 2 terabytes in size.

Source.Name: ncompress
Source.Description: The ncompress package contains the compress and uncompress file compression and decompression utilities, which are compatible with the original UNIX compress utility (.Z file extensions). These utilities can't handle gzipped (.gz file extensions) files, but gzip can handle compressed files.

Source.Name: gettext
Source.Summary: GNU libraries and utilities for producing multi-lingual messages
Source.Description: The GNU gettext package provides a set of tools and documentation for producing multi-lingual messages in programs. Tools include a set of conventions about how programs should be written to support message catalogs, a directory and file naming organization for the message catalogs, a runtime library which supports the retrieval of translated messages, and stand-alone programs for handling the translatable and the already translated strings. Gettext provides an easy to use library and tools for creating, using, and modifying natural language catalogs and is a powerful and simple method for internationalizing programs.

Source.Name: which
Source.Summary: Prints the location of specified executable in your path
Source.Description: which , Locates a program file in the user's path.

Source.Name: run-parts
Source.Summary: run scripts or programs in a directory
Source.Description: run scripts or programs in a directory

Source.Name: psmisc
Source.Summary: A set of tools that use the proc filesystem
Source.Description: PSmisc is a collection of small utilities using /proc file system, and providing the system administrator with some help in common tasks.

Source.Name: acl
Source.Description: The Acl package contains utilities to administer Access Control Lists, which are used to define more fine-grained discretionary access rights for files and directories.

Source.Name: ca-certificates
Source.Description: Common CA certificates

Source.Name: json-c
Source.Description: json-c implements a reference counting object model that allows you to easily construct JSON objects in C, output them as JSON formatted strings and parse JSON formatted strings back into the C representation of JSON objects.

Source.Name: nss-mdns
Source.Description: Name Service Switch module for Multicast DNS.

Source.Name: wireless-tools
Source.Summary: A collection of tools to configure wireless lan cards
Source.Description: The Wireless Tools (WT) is a set of tools allowing to manipulate the Wireless Extensions, a generic application programming interface allowing a driver to expose to the user space configuration and statistics specific to common Wireless LANs. They use a textual interface and are rather crude, but aim to support the full Wireless Extension.

Source.Name: iana-etc
Source.Summary: The Iana-Etc package provides data for network services and protocols.
Source.Description: The Iana-Etc package provides data for network services and protocols.

Source.Name: baselayout
Source.Description: baselayout creates the Sulin Linux main filesystem hierarchy.
Bu paket, Sulin dosya sisteminin temelini oluşturur.
Ce paquet crée la hiérarchie du système de fichier principal de Sulin.

Source.Name: glibc
Source.Summary: GNU libc6 (also called glibc2) C library
Source.Description: The Glibc package contains the main C library. This library provides the basic routines for allocating memory, searching directories, opening and closing files, reading and writing files, string handling, pattern matching, arithmetic, and so on.

Source.Name: libssh2
Source.Summary: A library implementing the SSH2 protocol
Source.Description: libssh2 is a library implementing the SSH2 protocol as defined by Internet Drafts: SECSH-TRANS, SECSH-USERAUTH, SECSH-CONNECTION, SECSH-ARCH, SECSH-FILEXFER, SECSH-DHGEX, SECSH-NUMBERS, and SECSH-PUBLICKEY.

Source.Name: pam
Source.Description: PAM (Pluggable Authentication Modules) is a system security tool that allows system administrators to set authentication policy without having to recompile programs that handle authentication.

Source.Name: libee
Source.Summary: An Event Expression Library inspired by CEE
Source.Description: Libee - An Event Expression Library inspired by CEE

Source.Name: libusb-compat
Source.Description: Project's main aim is to create a library for use by user level applications to access USB devices regardless of OS.

Source.Name: popt
Source.Description: The popt library exists essentially for parsing command line options with advantages such as there are no global variables, ability to parse an arbitrary array of argv-style elements, to exec external option filters, and automatic generation of help and usage messages, a standard method of option aliasing.

Source.Name: mailcap
Source.Summary: Helper application and MIME type associations for file types
Source.Description: mailcap file is used by the metamail program. Metamail reads the mailcap file to determine how it should display non-text or multimedia material.

Source.Name: file
Source.Summary: Program to identify a file's format by scanning binary data for patterns
Source.Description: Program to identify a file's format by scanning binary data for patterns.

Package.Name: python3-filemagic
Package.Summary: Python3 libraries of file package. It includes magic library for python3.

Package.Name: python-filemagic
Package.Summary: Python2 libraries of file package. It includes magic library for python2.

Source.Name: mingetty
Source.Summary: A compact getty program for virtual consoles only
Source.Description: mingetty, is a lightweight, minimalist getty for use on virtual consoles only.

Source.Name: findutils
Source.Description: The GNU Find Utilities are the basic directory searching utilities of the GNU operating system. These programs are typically used in conjunction with other programs to provide modular and powerful directory search and findutils locating capabilities to other commands.

Source.Name: lzo
Source.Summary: An extremely fast compression and decompression library
Source.Description: lzo is a library with very high compression and decompression speeds and very small memory usage. Provides low compression ratios but very high speeds.

Source.Name: grep
Source.Description: The grep command searches one or more input files for lines containing a match to a specified pattern. By default, grep prints the matching lines.

Source.Name: nettle
Source.Summary: The Nettle package contains the low-level cryptographic library
Source.Description: The Nettle package contains the low-level cryptographic library that is designed to fit easily in many contexts.

Source.Name: ppl
Source.Description: ppl is the Parma Polyhedra Library that provides numerical abstractions for analysis of complex systems.

Source.Name: numactl
Source.Description: numactl consists of a numactl program to run other programs with a specific NUMA policy and a libnuma to do allocations with NUMA policy in applications.

Source.Name: automake
Source.Summary: A tool for automatically generating Makefile.in files compliant with the GNU Coding Standards
Source.Description: Automake is a tool for automatically generating Makefile.in files compliant with the GNU Coding Standards.

Source.Name: xcb-proto
Source.Description: XCB is a project to enable efficient language bindings to the X11 protocol. This package contains the protocol descriptions themselves. Language bindings use these protocol descriptions to generate code for marshalling the protocol.

Source.Name: libuv
Source.Summary: Multi-platform support library with a focus on asynchronous I/O
Source.Description: libuv is a multi-platform support library with a focus on asynchronous I/O. It was primarily developed for use by Node.js, but it's also used by Luvit, Julia, pyuv, and others.

Source.Name: libxslt
Source.Description: Libxslt is the XSLT C library developed for the GNOME project. XSLT itself is a an XML language to define transformation for XML.

Source.Name: isl
Source.Description: isl is a library for manipulating sets and relations of integer points bounded by linear constraints.

Source.Name: perl-XML-Parser
Source.Summary: A Perl extension interface to James Clark's XML parser, expat
Source.Description: This module provides an interface to James Clark's XML parser, expat. As in expat, a single instance of the parser can only parse one document. Calls to parsestring after the first for a given instance will die.

Source.Name: cmake
Source.Description: CMake, the cross-platform, open-source make system. CMake is used to control the software compilation process using simple platform and compiler independent configuration files. CMake generates native makefiles and workspaces that can be used in the compiler environment of your choice.

Source.Name: libmpc
Source.Summary: High precision and correct rounding library
Source.Description: libmpc is a library for arithmetic of complex numbers with arbitrarily high precision and correct rounding.

Source.Name: make
Source.Summary: Standard tool to compile source trees
Source.Description: Standard tool to compile source trees. Make gets its knowledge of how to build your program from a file called the makefile. When you write a program, you should write a makefile for it, so that it is possible to use Make to build and install the program

Source.Name: glpk
Source.Description: The GLPK (GNU Linear Programming Kit) package is intended for solving large-scale linear programming (LP), mixed integer programming (MIP), and other related problems. It is a set of routines written in ANSI C and organized in the form of a callable library.

Source.Name: xorg-util
Source.Description: xorg-util contains some Xorg X11 command-line utilities, but more importantly, X11 configuration and rule files.

Source.Name: rhash
Source.Summary: Hash sums are used to ensure and verify integrity of large volumes of data for a long-term storing or transferring.
Source.Description: RHash is a console utility for calculation and verification of magnet links and a wide range of hash sums like CRC32, MD4, MD5, SHA1, SHA256, SHA512, SHA3, AICH, ED2K, Tiger, DC++ TTH, BitTorrent BTIH, GOST R 34.11-94,RIPEMD-160, HAS-160, EDON-R, Whirlpool and Snefru.

Source.Name: mpfr
Source.Description: The MPFR library is a C library for multiple-precision floating-point computations with exact rounding (also called correct rounding). It is based on the GMP multiple-precision library.

Source.Name: cloog
Source.Description: cloog is CLooG is a free software and library to generate code for scanning Z-polyhedra. It is used by the GCC Graphite optimization framework.

Source.Name: yasm
Source.Summary: Assembler that supports many syntaxes and architectures
Source.Description: A complete rewrite of the NASM assembler under the "new" BSD License. Yasm currently supports the x86 and AMD64 instruction sets, accepts NASM and GAS assembler syntaxes, outputs binary, ELF32, ELF64, 32 and 64-bit Mach-O, RDOFF2, COFF, Win32, and Win64 object formats and generates source debugging information in STABS, DWARF 2, and CodeView? 8 formats.

Source.Name: libatomic_ops
Source.Description: libatomic_ops provides implementations for atomic memory update operations on a number of architectures. This allows direct use of these in reasonably portable code.

Source.Name: colorgcc
Source.Description: A tool that colorizes GCC output.

Source.Name: yacc
Source.Description: Yacc provides a general tool for describing the input to a computer program. The Yacc user specifies the structures of his input, together with code to be invoked as each such structure is recognized. Yacc turns such a specification into a subroutine that handles the input process

Source.Name: scons
Source.Summary: An Open Source software construction tool
Source.Description: Think of SCons as an improved, cross-platform substitute for the classic Make utility with integrated functionality similar to autoconf/automake and compiler caches such as ccache.

Source.Name: libseccomp
Source.Description: High level interface to the Linux Kernel's seccomp filter.

Source.Name: autoconf-archive
Source.Summary: A collection of freely re-usable Autoconf macros
Source.Description: The GNU Autoconf Archive is a collection of more than 500 macros for GNU Autoconf that have been contributed as free software by friendly supporters of the cause from all over the Internet.

Package.Name: autoconf-archive
Package.Summary: A collection of freely re-usable Autoconf macros

Source.Name: xorg-proto
Source.Description: This package includes the protocol headers needed for X11 development.

Source.Name: elfutils
Source.Description: elfutils contains libraries and utilities to handle ELF objects and is a replacement for libelf.

Source.Name: nasm
Source.Description: NASM is the Netwide Assembler, a free portable assembler for the Intel 80x86 microprocessor series.

Source.Name: bison
Source.Description: A bison-compatible parser generator. Once you are proficient with Bison, you can use it to develop a wide range of language parsers, from those used in simple desk calculators to complex programming languages

Source.Name: gnuconfig
Source.Description: gnuconfig contains updated config.sub and config.guess files from GNU.

Source.Name: chrpath
Source.Summary: Change the dynamic library load path (rpath) of binaries
Source.Description: chrpath allows you to modify the dynamic library load path (rpath and runpath) of compiled programs and libraries.

Source.Name: binutils
Source.Summary: Toolkit for handling assembly object files.
Assembly obje dosyalarıyla çalışmak için bir araç seti.
Source.Description: Contains linker, assembler and other tools like as, ld, nm, objdump, ar, ranlib for compiling assembly code to the machine language, and for linking and manipulating the binary object files.
Assebly kodları makine diline çevirmek veya onları değiştirip düzenlemek için kullanılan bağlayıcı (linker), assembler ve as, ld, nm, objdump, ar, ranlib gibi araçları içerir.

Package.Name: binutils-pages
Package.Summary: binutils paketi için linux manual sayfaları.

Source.Name: cryptsetup
Source.Summary: Userspace setup tool for transparent encryption of block devices using dm-crypt
Source.Description: Userspace setup tool for transparent encryption of block devices using dm-crypt

Source.Name: autogen
Source.Summary: The automated text and program generation tool
Source.Description: autogen is a tool designed to simplify the creation and maintenance of programs that contain large amounts of repetitious text.

Source.Name: guile
Source.Description: GUILE (GNU's Ubiquitous Intelligent Language for Extension) is a library implementation of the Scheme programming language, written in C. GUILE provides a machine-independent execution platform that can be linked in as a library during the building of extensible programs.

Source.Name: gc
Source.Summary: A garbage collector for C and C++
Source.Description: The Boehm-Demers-Weiser conservative garbage collector can be used as a garbage collecting replacement for C malloc or C++ new.

Source.Name: libsigsegv
Source.Summary: A library for handling page faults in user mode
Source.Description: This is a library for handling page faults in user mode. A page fault occurs when a program tries to access to a region of memory that is currently not available.

Source.Name: m4
Source.Description: The m4 utility is a macro processor that shall read one or more text files, process them according to their included macro statements, and write the results to standard output

Source.Name: autoconf
Source.Description: Used to create autoconfiguration files, Autoconf is an extensible package of m4 macros that produce shell scripts to automatically configure software source code packages.

Source.Name: pkgconfig
Source.Summary: Package Config system that manages compile/link flags for libraries
Source.Description: Package Config system that manages compile/link flags for libraries. It helps you insert the correct compiler options on the command line.

Source.Name: dietlibc
Source.Summary: A libc optimized for small size
Source.Description: dietlibc is a libc that is optimized for small size. It can be used to create small statically linked binaries for Linux on various architectures.

Source.Name: libarchive
Source.Summary: Library for reading and writing streaming archives
Source.Description: libarchive includes a library and command-line tools for reading and writing tar, cpio, zip, ISO, and other archive formats.

Source.Name: klibc
Source.Summary: A minimal libc subset for use with initramfs
Source.Description: klibc, or "early userspace", is library part of an effort which tries to move as much initialization code in Linux as possible out of the kernel.

Source.Name: intltool
Source.Summary: Utility for internationalizing various kinds of data files
Source.Description: intltool automatically extracts translatable strings from oaf, glade, bonobo ui, nautilus theme, .desktop files, etc. and puts them in the po files.

Source.Name: meson
Source.Description: A high performance build system

Source.Name: gcc
Source.Summary: The GNU Compiler Collection, includes C, C++, Objective-C and Fortran compilers
Source.Description: The GNU Compiler Collection includes front ends for C, C++, Objective-C, Fortran, as well as libraries for these languages

Package.Name: libquadmath
Package.Summary: The GNU Fortran Compiler Quadmath Runtime Library

Package.Name: libgcc
Package.Summary: Contains a shared library of support routines used by GCC's runtime, and thus by every program on the system

Package.Name: libgomp
Package.Summary: Contains GCC shared support library which is needed for OpenMP 2.5 support

Package.Name: libgfortran
Package.Summary: Contains GCC shared support library for gfortran

Package.Name: libgccgo
Package.Summary: Contains GCC shared support library for golang.

Package.Name: libobjc
Package.Summary: Contains GCC shared support library for objc

Package.Name: gcc-l10n
Package.Summary: Contains available GCC localization files, includes also turkish translations

Source.Name: snappy
Source.Description: Snappy is a compression/decompression library. It does not aim for maximum compression, or compatibility with any other compression library; instead, it aims for very high speeds and reasonable compression.

Source.Name: patch
Source.Description: Patch takes a patch file generated by diff command, and applies it to the original files, thus producing patched files.

Source.Name: libtool
Source.Summary: A shared library tool for developers
Source.Description: Libtool is a shared library tool for developers.

Source.Name: check
Source.Summary: A unit test framework for C
Source.Description: check is a unit testing framework for C. It features a simple interface for defining unit tests, putting little in the way of the developer. Tests are run in a separate address space, so Check can catch both assertion failures and code errors that cause segmentation faults or other signals. The output from unit tests can be used within source code editors and IDEs.

Source.Name: flex
Source.Description: Flex is a tool for generating scanners. A scanner, sometimes called a tokenizer, is a program which recognizes lexical patterns in text

Source.Name: gmp
Source.Description: GMP is a free library for arbitrary precision arithmetic, operating on signed integers, rational numbers, and floating point numbers. There is no practical limit to the precision except the ones implied by the available memory in the machine GMP runs on. GMP has a rich set of functions, and the functions have a regular interface.

Source.Name: unifdef
Source.Summary: The unifdef utility selectively processes conditional cpp(1) directives
Source.Description: The unifdef utility selectively processes conditional cpp(1) directives. It removes from a file both the directives and any additional text that they specify should be removed, while otherwise leaving the file alone.

Source.Name: xtrans
Source.Description: xtrans includes a number of routines to make X implementations transport-independent.

Source.Name: util-macros
Source.Description: X.Org X11 autotools macros are required for building the various packages that comprise the X Window System.

Source.Name: elogind
Source.Description: The systemd project's logind, extracted to a standalone package

Source.Name: polkit
Source.Summary: Sistem bileşenleri için erişim politikası servisi
Source.Description: polkit is a toolkit for defining and handling authorizations. It is used for allowing unprivileged processes to speak to privileged processes.
polkit, sistem genelindeki bileşenlerin ve masaüstü bileşenlerinin ayarlayabileceği şekilde ilkeler tanımlamak için araçlardan oluşur.
polkit est un cadre de développement (framework) pour définir des politiques à appliquer à des composants du système ainsi que fournir à des parties du bureau la possibilité de les configurer.

Source.Name: bc
Source.Description: bc is an arbitrary precision numeric processing language and can be used as a calculator. Syntax is similar to C, but differs in many substantial areas. For example, it supports interactive execution of statements.

Source.Name: nano
Source.Summary: GNU GPL'd Pico clone with more functionality
Source.Description: Nano is a small, free and friendly editor which aims to replace Pico, the default editor included in the non-free Pine package. Rather than just copying Pico's look and feel, nano also implements some missing (or disabled by default) features in Pico, such as "search and replace" and "go to line number".

Source.Name: vi
Source.Description: The original ex/vi text editor.

Source.Name: freetype
Source.Summary: A high-quality and portable font engine
Source.Description: FreeType 2 is a software font engine that is designed to be small, efficient, highly customizable, and portable while capable of producing high-quality output. It can be used in graphics libraries, display servers, font conversion tools, text image generation tools, and many other products as well.
